review: We staid three nights on the standart room upstairs with sea view. Was confortable and nice. All what you need  the service was stuning. The beach was quite and nice beatiful. Area is quite. An europerean people. If you dont want parties and noice on koh samui .this is the place to relax.  We recomend this little hotel cause is quite and private and unique style.  And the food ia realy great and  the staff was friendly.

title: Mixed bag!
review: As a couple, we stayed at Hammock in mid-september.   As far as value for money goes, this little place was excellent.  At the time, $AUD 33 per night including breakfast for a standard bungalow.   Breakfast was pretty good,  your choice of eggs made to order and all basic fruits,  cereal, toast, bacon, salad and an asian alternative (eg, fried rice), as well as filter coffee and tea were all a part of the buffet. Any extras such as a milk based coffee (cappuccino/latte) were extra to which was added to your room bill. All other meals we had during our stay were great and of variety between western and thai food.  As for the room well, it was a mixed bag. The rendered bungalows were adorable to look at. Each with a front porch or balcony,  complete with a table and chairs.…

title: Nice Boutique Hotel - Great Location
review: We stayed at the Hammock hotel for two-weeks, after evacuating the crappy hotel behind there.  The Hammock was great. We really enjoyed our stay.   We had one of the beach front rooms and it didn't disappoint. The room decor was well done, and had great character. Nice bright white concrete rooms. Minimalist in nature, good lighting in the rooms and comfortable beds.   We could roll over in bed and catch the sunrise.   The food was actually quite tasty, and well done. The breakfast was predictable and of good quality.   The internet quality was excellent. We enjoyed the town and could still get some work done.  The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and non-overbearing.   The beach in MaeNam is nice because it's not overrun. While the sand and water clarity isn't as good, the…

title: Very good original hotel at reasonable price
review: Located in Mae Nam beach in a quiet location. Some bars, restaurants and shops available in the area.  The hotel style is a little bit "funky" and really nice. We had a standard bungalow. The bungalows are close to each others but there are plants in between them that give a nice atmosphere. The bungalow we had had no view but it was very close from the pool and the sea. (there are however much more expensive bungalows with either pool or direct sea view).  Warm welcome with a drink from the friendly staff.  The bungalows are not big but the interior is well furnished. They have a small terrace. Silent AC. Bedding is good and bathroom is OK (not very big).  Safe, mini bar and flat TV in each bungalow.  Free wifi in the room/restaurant/pool area. Towels and beach towels provided.…

title: Very nice relaxing place
review: Very cute and small resort. The houses are small but perfect for two. The breakfast is very good. The beach is nice and quiet. The view is amazing! The only thing "negative" to say about this resort is that the small town is quiet and has not many bars/resaurants. But if you rent a scooter you can get around easy.

title: Best in Mae Nam
review: Stayed here for a week after a disaster of a week in another resort...friendliness and location of the place was awesome,great beach and choose a beach side bungalow. .the restaurant serves tasty,fresh uncomplicated food,staff friendly and helpful,rooms clean,stunning king size bed...what more can one ask for..will be back in 2015 :))

title: Directly on the beach
review: Very nice hotel. Not too big, directly on the beach. Located in a more quiet part of the island, which is called Mae Nam Beach. Not like the noisy and busy Chaweng. You can easily rent a motor bike/scooter and cruise the island for 200 Baht a day (5 euro).   The hotel has nice rooms, especially the ones facing the sea. We stayed in the ones on the pool and they were great as well. The other ones behind ours were a bit packed on the other rooms.   The hotel did offer a great breakfast, although it was not included according to booking.com. And from the hotel you can go swimming directly in the sea, which is clean. No sharp stones or coral. Sand is a bit more coarse then in Chaweng but still fine.  Only point for improvement was the Wifi connection. This was not working most of…

title: Right on the beach
review: The best part of the hotel is that is right on the beach, you have breakfast watching the sea and this is great!  The staff is really nice and helpfull, the services offered are really expensive tough, compared to what you can find in Any othere agency in Mae Nam.

title: Great location and good food
review: Great location in the middle of Maenam beach...lots of beach restaurants nearby, but the food at Hammock Samui is really good, too! (We liked the glass noodle and the skewers). The rates were good and the room was pretty nice (the only downside was that there was very little ventilation in the room and it felt damp). Overall, we would recommend staying here!

title: Greate lacation and sea view !!!
review: Hotel is located on the middle of Maenam. Great view to Koh Phan Gan and the sea. Excellent beach that is always empty. Easy to find free lounge. Good breakfast. Good service. Close to main restaurants and working street. But very very small rooms. It is worth to stay there. Great value for money.

title: Stay here !!
review: Super relaxing, great location and nice staff! Stayed for 3 nights - comfy king beds and excellent wifi, staff were really friendly and helpful - the beach is beautiful - would stay here agin in a heart beat.

title: Small beachfront hotel, good location and views
review: The Hammock is basically a 1.5-2 star hotel that has a great location.  As we checked in, no one helped us with our baggage which we had to drag through the narrow drive, moving laundry out of our way, and then pick up and carry to our room.  (I was expected to give the bellman a tip after that).  I am glad we booked a beachfront room, otherwise the rooms are very small.  Not good if you have lots of luggage.  The beachfront room does have a very nice view of the water and two private mats that you can relax on, or chairs that are less than 5 feet away.  Walking along the beach there is a great vender that sells fruit and grilled corn.  The breakfast is nothing to rave about, but it was free and was a good snack before we began our day.  The bar’s mixed drinks are so-so.  The…

title: fantastic location on quiet clean beach-gentle sea, smiling staff, small new resort.
review: My daughter and I booked this hotel online after checking a few websites including TripAdvisor. We chose Mae Nam beach  for its reputation for being quiet and Hammock Samui Beach Resort for its good deals When we arrived in mid March, we were upgraded to the Beachfront Bungalow as the one we booked was taken. This Beachfront Bungalow was one floor up which was a little difficult for middle-aged me but the view was really spectacular.The only major drawback was that the drains from the toilet did not seem to work properly and there was a stench when we arrived. This was rectified with chlorine bleach poured into it. But this had to be done regularly during our entire stay.  We paid and stayed for a weekend and breakfast was part of the price. It was a good, substantial breakfast.…

title: Cute little one
review: I was there with my boyfriends for 2 nights for a short vacation in Samui. We've never been to Samui before so had no clues where was the hotel and found the staffs were very helpful giving direction. Finally we got to the hotel by our car and found out there was no space to park my car. Anyway, the room we're in was lovely - it was a P-02. The shower curtain is a pain coz it would wrapped you up when you were showering. Rain shower was best! I love it. :) The swimming pool is too small and it is too close to the reception and the restaurant so we were too shy to swim there. The beach chairs were nice, the beachfront is lovely. The food and a quality of breakfast buffet is fair. Not fault for booking this hotel.

title: Finally! Quiet paradise!
review: After a week in noisy Bangkok & Chiang Rai, I was desperate for quiet sleep & was glad I chose Mae Nam over much noisier Chaweng.  Resort: stunning view on beach, good breakfast, nice staff (thank you Gandi for everything!), clean, smallish room (ie not big enough to do a workout), but hot water (took me 3 days to figure out how to get the right mix of warm on the taps), they provide beach bag & big towels, DVD movies, kettle/coffee in room, frig, AC (unfortunately couldn't change angle so sort of blasted the face at night & have to pay more to leave on while out), little deck. Grounds are adorable, leafy path to bungalows, well-kept, tidy, thick but plentiful pillows. The best: soooo quiet! They have strict noise rules so utterly silent by 9pm. Bliss! Reception "closes" at 11…

title: Poor management.
review: Couldn't find the place. NO SIGNS AT ALL. No parking. When we asked for an extra bed they said: sorry no housekeeping. They also said we are not allowed to have an extra blanket. What kind of management allows policies like this? Luckily the gentleman at the front desk gave us some blankets later on. Sorry to say but the food was over priced and deep fried from frozen. After a seven hour journey with four kids in the car this was an absolutely appalling experience. Never again.

title: Lovely Little Place, tucked away in Maenam Beach
review: First of all, we would like to say thank you for choosing The Hammock Samui Resort and for sharing your experiences from The Hammock. We all value our guests reviews and use it as an effective tool to do our best in improving our services.   Generally, maximum number of person for accomodation on the room category you have booked is for 2 persons only. Children below 5 years old are free of charge if utilizing the same bed as the guardians. Children above 5 years old, normally, are charged additionally with extra breakfast only. But if it were 4 persons stayed in 1 room, we would normally charge the guests  with an extra bed which we heard you did not agreed with, and the request was made at passed 10 in the evening, which our housekeepers are already off duty.  We do our purchasing twice a week, and since we only cater to a total 26 guests rooms, we don't normally purchase a lot and we priced them reasonably and comparably to others. But we respect your opinion about it and we will certainly  try our best to do better.  We are also sorry if the signage at the main road and on the next street are not visible enough, but mostly, our guests gives us calls to ask for further directions, or if not, we send someone to go and pick them up to the point where it is easy and convenient for them.  Again, thank you for your review, we will take this review seriously to do better in the future.

title: Nice quiet hideaway
review: We stayed at the Hammock Samui Beach Resort for 7 days and nights from 2 Feb 2013, our aim was to use it as a base to tour Samui Island, which we did. We were in a beach front room and had an extremely good experience. The staff were very friendly, breakfast was buffet, eat as much as you like. The hotel  is a series of concrete huts making up rooms, our room was a decent size but we had the high end choice. Our room was right on the beach with views of Koh Phangan. Maid service was very good, clean towels every day. We ate in the restaurant 3 evenings and I must say that the European food was excellent, I didn’t try the Thai food because the other 4 evenings we ate out in Samui. The only down side for me was that I hired a car and this hotel doesn’t have a car park, but they do…

title: A small boutique place, nice details!
review: We enjoyed staying here in Mae Nam Village, at the Hammock. A trendy place, good value for money. The rooms are a bit small but comfortable and they have even a nice beach bag for the beach towels. Staff friendly and helpful. There is a computor with free internet to borrow in the reception/bar area. Cool red bean bags to chill in by the pool. I never saw anyone use it, but for children it might be good and it looks nice! Thursday evening is the Walking Street in the village. Go there! We walked along the beach 5 min to the right to Moonhut Bungalows for lunch as we had fiends staying there. Their food was always delicious. We had dinner once at The Hammock which was also good. The breakfast was a bit poor.

title: Perfect, loved out stay here
review: After spending 4 days in patong Phuket the hammock was a nice change, all the staff here are super friendly and this made our stay amazing.. I really don't want to leave, the beaches are beautiful and by far the best food I have had on our whole stay in Thailand.. Can't wait to come back :)

title: Hammock by name hammock by nature!
review: So relaxing! Away from the hype of Chaweng this is a real Haven in Samui. Modern minimalist decor, beautiful location, excellent breakfast, staff who just can't do enough to make your stay more comfortable yet are not in any way invasive. I intended to arrive here on Friday night but unfortunately missed my ferry as such arriving at 7am the following morning. My room was ready straight away on arrival. I pre booked and prepaid my accommodation and it was entirely my own fault however the staff kindly offered a late check out free of charge until 6pm Sunday when I depart for Phanang.  In addition to all mod cons, rooms come complete beach bag and beach towels. They really seem to have thought of everything, the extra little touches make for a very relaxing stay!
